From the district music teacher:

Parents, Music is huge part of our everyday lives! Here are ways you can incorporate music into this time of learning at home.

* Make instruments from items found around the house (drums, shakers, guitars).
* Learn to juggle. Juggling well requires rhythm. Start with scarves. They move more slowly through the air.
* Put on music and dance together. The funnier your dance, the better. Dance with scarves or balloons, do a freeze dance, dance like an animal. Play music with different speeds and moods.
* Play a piece of music and have your child describe the mood and feelings listening to it creates. Any genre will work ‚Äì classical, jazz, rock, pop, musicals, etc.
* Make up a Stomp routine. Stomp uses everyday items and uses them to make up a dance routine. Brooms, balls, buckets, use your imagination!
* Compose a rap or song about something new they have learned, or about their day. Have a concert to perform the creations.

Whatever you choose to do with music, have fun!
- Kim Grissom
